intro: Hemionitis chihuahuaensis, commonly known as the Chihuahua fern, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Chihuahua region of Mexico. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or limestone soils. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing sporangia, are located on the underside of its leaves. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Hemionitis chihuahuaensis is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
